text:
Hey, If I am using *`LoggingControl`* should I expect to see a 1:1 match of *`_process_cleared_orders_meta`* orders and *`_process_cleared_orders`* ?

• I am noting that *`_process_cleared_orders_meta`* has 10x the amount of orders data than *`_process_cleared_orders`* 
• by filtering for `order.cleared_order` I approximately, get more of a match, but not that close
What am I missing here? I am using the exact example from *<https://github.com/betcode-org/flumine/blob/master/examples/controls/backtestloggingcontrol.py|here>*

text:
I want to bet as close to the off as possible in horse racing. What's the best way to do this? 

1) just bet at the off time - but what happened when there is a delay? 
2) bet when we get the signal of "at the post" or approaching - again is this the best signal. I see these signals are in for sometimes several minutes. 
Any other smart options?

elements.text:

text: Race status API
